title: Aguascalientes City
summary: Aguascalientes (Spanish pronunciation: [ˌaɣwaskaˈljentes] (listen)) is the capital of the state of Aguascalientes and is its most populous city, with a metropolitan population of 1,225,432.[1] It is one of the safest and most prosperous cities in Mexico.[2][3] It is located in North-Central Mexico. It was part of the kingdom of Nueva Galicia. In 1835 Aguascalientes became the capital of the Free and Sovereign State of Aguascalientes.[4] Aguascalientes has been called the cleanest city in Latin America.[5] Aguascalientes is experiencing an ongoing social, economic, and aesthetic revitalization process.[6] Aguascalientes has a population which includes Japanese, Koreans, Venezuelans, Spaniards, Canadians and Germans.
